messages.subject: harsh judgement was ( Re: Digest Number 3840)
messages.msgSnippet: ... who never post out of fear of harsh judgement and attacks. That s pretty sad. I can t say I m at all surprised though at this point.
messages.messageBody:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>After posting I've gotten quite a few responses privately from
>>>>>>>>>>>>>others
who never post out of fear of harsh judgement and attacks. That's
pretty sad. I can't say I'm at all surprised though at this point.
Jeva<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<


I hardly ever post, not out of fear, but because by the time I figure out
what I want to say, someone else says it much more eloquently, and because I
get a LOT more from just reading. If I were always posting, I wouldn't have
time to absorb much. I haven't noticed that any of the helpful unschoolers
here judge anyone. What I see is them trying to get people who don't "get
it" to GET it, that is why people come here after all, I hope. That's why
I'm here, to help my family stay on track. In the last seven months or so,
I have seen the most beautiful change in my kids, and myself, and it's
because of the things I've learned here. So I remain, unafraid, quietly
observing the discussions about unschooling. <G>

Tammy
